page.title: 17THORNTON LE MOOR VILLAGE (2)
page.content: We went down the backlane in the village and the flowers on the banks and in the hedges that we saw were, vetch,brambles,elderberries dogrose, bird's eye and clover! We went down the lane that leads away from the piggeries and saw cultivated fields. The crops growing were wheat and barley. On the bank at the east of the village were several new trees. These had been planted by the children of the village. By each tree was a little plaque giving the name of the children who had planted it. There were also roses planted around the village seat and in the spring daffodils grow in the grass verges on the approach roads into the village. Many houses in the village use to have a well in their gardens,as the village has a high water-table.
